metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5230 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The DNS packet parsing/generation code in PowerDNS (aka pdns) AuthoritativeServer 3.4.x before 3.4.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (crash) via crafted query packets.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5230` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-backend-geoip - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-backend-ldap - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-backend-lua - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-backend-mydns - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-backend-mysql - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-backend-pipe - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-backend-remote - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-backend-tinydns - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-server - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
pdns-tools - 4.0.0~alpha2-3build1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pdns package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.0~alpha2-3build1').
